ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:0.5_0: The training rule on borrowed robes
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.2_0: there was a nun who, after walking for almsfood, spread out her moist robe and entered her dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.3_0: A certain nun robed up to her and entered her village for alms.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.4_0: Soon afterwards the first nun came out and asked the nuns,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.6_0: The nuns told her what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.7_0: She then complained and criticized the second nun,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.8_0: “How can a nun put on my robe without asking permission?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.10_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.11_0: “How can a nun put on another nun’s robe without asking permission?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.12_0: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.15_0: “... How can a nun do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.17_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.18.1_0: ‘If a nun takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1.6_0: if she wears any of the five robes belonging to a fully ordained nun, and it has not been given to her, nor has she asked permission to use it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.1_0: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.2_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.3_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.4_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.5_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.6_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.7_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.2_0: if the other nun gives it back;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.3_0: if she wears it after asking permission;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.4_0: if her robe has been stolen;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.5_0: if her own robe has been lost;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.8_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.9_0: The fifth training rule is finished.
